items.title: The origins of your dog's unique look may be older than you think
items.description: A new study finds that about half of the physical variation seen in modern dogs existed during the Stone Age.

items.title: How the turkey trotted its way onto our Thanksgiving tables — and into our lexicon
items.description: Much of the turkey's early history is shrouded in uncertainty, historians and etymologists say — which is particularly true of how the bird got its na...

items.title: The U.S. produces a lot of food waste. This place wants to address it
items.description: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.

items.title: Pope Leo XIV to visit Turkey and Lebanon on first foreign trip

items.title: Italy now recognizes the crime of femicide and punishes it with life in prison
